George I defined resilience is an
outcome so we have to have an aversive
event and then after that event people
respond a resilient outcome is a stable
pattern a stable trajectory of healthy
adjustment functioning normally as if
the event essentially is if the event
didn't happen as if it didn't happen we
get back to some kind of normal we might
have a brief interruption but otherwise
stable trajectory of healthy functioning
all right friend this is really great
transition here because I would say it's
not an outcome it's a process and it's
not about stability it's about
adaptability and in fact there are some
circumstances where remaining stable may
in fact be the worst thing for

study resilience from a medical point of

with the HIV virus some develop AIDS in

view so then we began to look at

at a negative definition you don't have

that means we are neither indifferent or
